payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
Frontend code lives in `apps/web/src`. Client routes use React Router under `src/routes`, reusable UI sits in `src/components`, and feature-specific logic is grouped inside `src/features/<feature>`. Shared hooks (`src/hooks`), utilities (`src/lib`), and design tokens (`src/styles`) keep cross-cutting concerns centralized. Static assets belong in `public`. Keep new modules aligned with this layout so imports remain predictable.

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `npm run dev`: Launches the Vite dev server with React Fast Refresh.
- `npm run build`: Produces an optimized production bundle via Vite; run before deploys.
- `npm run preview`: Serves the latest build locally for smoke-testing production output.
- `npm run lint`: Executes the project-wide ESLint rules. Treat warnings as errors before opening a PR.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Use modern ES modules with functional React components. Prefer two-space indentation and trailing commas, matching the existing files. Components that render UI should use PascalCase filenames (`ThemeToggle.jsx`), hooks use camelCase prefixed with `use` (`use-mobile.js`), and utility modules go in `src/lib` with hyphenated names. Favor Tailwind classes for styling; co-locate any component-specific CSS in `src/styles` only if a utility class will not suffice. Run `npm run lint` to ensure ESLint (configured in `eslint.config.mjs`) flags accessibility and performance regressions early.

## Testing Guidelines
Automated tests are not yet wired in. When adding them, group specs beside their feature (`src/features/navigation/__tests__/NavMenu.test.jsx`) so intent is obvious. Name files with `.test.jsx` or `.test.js`. For critical flows lacking automation, document manual verification steps in the PR description and exercise them against `npm run start` output. Keep database interactions mocked or pointed at disposable fixtures to avoid mutating shared environments.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Craft commit subjects in the imperative mood (“Add navigation badges”), roughly 50 characters, with optional detail in the body. Combine related changes rather than batching multiple features. Pull requests should include: a concise summary, linked issue IDs, screenshots or clip recordings for UI changes, and notes on testing performed (`npm run lint`, manual checks, etc.). Request reviews from owners of affected areas (`src/features/<feature>` or shared libs) before merging.

## Environment & Configuration Tips
Local MySQL connectivity is managed via `src/lib/db.js`, which reads `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`, and `DB_NAME`. Place secrets in `.env.local`; never commit credentials. Tailwind configuration is defined through `components.json` and `postcss.config.mjs`. If you introduce new design tokens, update `src/styles/tokens.css` and keep class names consistent with Tailwind’s utility-first approach. Frontend env vars for Vite must be prefixed with `VITE_`.

content.text:
# AGENTS.md instructions for /home/pjw75/tailwind

<INSTRUCTIONS>
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
Frontend code lives in `apps/web/src`. Client routes use React Router under `src/routes`, reusable UI sits in `src/components`, and feature-specific logic is grouped inside `src/features/<feature>`. Shared hooks (`src/hooks`), utilities (`src/lib`), and design tokens (`src/styles`) keep cross-cutting concerns centralized. Static assets belong in `public`. Keep new modules aligned with this layout so imports remain predictable.

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `npm run dev`: Launches the Vite dev server with React Fast Refresh.
- `npm run build`: Produces an optimized production bundle via Vite; run before deploys.
- `npm run preview`: Serves the latest build locally for smoke-testing production output.
- `npm run lint`: Executes the project-wide ESLint rules. Treat warnings as errors before opening a PR.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Use modern ES modules with functional React components. Prefer two-space indentation and trailing commas, matching the existing files. Components that render UI should use PascalCase filenames (`ThemeToggle.jsx`), hooks use camelCase prefixed with `use` (`use-mobile.js`), and utility modules go in `src/lib` with hyphenated names. Favor Tailwind classes for styling; co-locate any component-specific CSS in `src/styles` only if a utility class will not suffice. Run `npm run lint` to ensure ESLint (configured in `eslint.config.mjs`) flags accessibility and performance regressions early.

## Testing Guidelines
Automated tests are not yet wired in. When adding them, group specs beside their feature (`src/features/navigation/__tests__/NavMenu.test.jsx`) so intent is obvious. Name files with `.test.jsx` or `.test.js`. For critical flows lacking automation, document manual verification steps in the PR description and exercise them against `npm run start` output. Keep database interactions mocked or pointed at disposable fixtures to avoid mutating shared environments.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Craft commit subjects in the imperative mood (“Add navigation badges”), roughly 50 characters, with optional detail in the body. Combine related changes rather than batching multiple features. Pull requests should include: a concise summary, linked issue IDs, screenshots or clip recordings for UI changes, and notes on testing performed (`npm run lint`, manual checks, etc.). Request reviews from owners of affected areas (`src/features/<feature>` or shared libs) before merging.

## Environment & Configuration Tips
Local MySQL connectivity is managed via `src/lib/db.js`, which reads `DB_HOST`, `DB_PORT`, `DB_USER`, `DB_PASSWORD`, and `DB_NAME`. Place secrets in `.env.local`; never commit credentials. Tailwind configuration is defined through `components.json` and `postcss.config.mjs`. If you introduce new design tokens, update `src/styles/tokens.css` and keep class names consistent with Tailwind’s utility-first approach. Frontend env vars for Vite must be prefixed with `VITE_`.

</INSTRUCTIONS>

   * needtosend 드래프트 값 컨트롤러
   * ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
  const setNeedToSendDraftValue = React.useCallback((recordId, value) => {
    if (!recordId) return
    setNeedToSendDrafts((prev) => ({ ...prev, [recordId]: value }))
  }, [])

  const removeNeedToSendDraftValue = React.useCallback((recordId) => {
    if (!recordId) return
    setNeedToSendDrafts((prev) => removeKey(prev, recordId))
  }, [])

  /* ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   * TanStack Table의 meta로 내려줄 컨트롤/상태 모음
   * - 셀 컴포넌트(CommentCell/NeedToSendCell)가 이 객체의 함수를 직접 호출
   * ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
  const tableMeta = {
    commentDrafts,
    commentEditing,
    needToSendDrafts,
    updatingCells,
    updateErrors,
    cellIndicators,
    clearUpdateError,
    setCommentDraftValue,
    removeCommentDraftValue,
    setCommentEditingState,
    setNeedToSendDraftValue,
    removeNeedToSendDraftValue,
    handleUpdate,
  }

  /* ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
   * 훅 바깥에서 쓸 값들 반환
   *  - isLoadingRows / rowsError / lastFetchedCount: 로드 상태와 피드백
   *  - fetchRows: 새로고침(리로드) 버튼 등에 연결 가능
   * ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── */
  return {
    selectedTable,
    columns,
    rows,
    fromDate,
    setFromDate,
    toDate,
    setToDate,
    appliedFrom,
    appliedTo,
    filter,
    setFilter,
    sorting,
    setSorting,
    isLoadingRows,
    rowsError,
    lastFetchedCount,
    fetchRows,
    tableMeta,
    recentHoursRange,
    setRecentHoursRange,
  }
}

payload.text:
**Proposing DataTable restructuring**

I'll redesign the DataTable by extracting hooks for last-updated label and pagination guards, plus a TableBodyRows component to improve readability and maintainability. I'll carefully reorganize state, effects, and helpers, aiming to centralize pagination logic and handle rendering logic cleanly while preserving current behavior.

summary.text:
**Proposing DataTable restructuring**

I'll redesign the DataTable by extracting hooks for last-updated label and pagination guards, plus a TableBodyRows component to improve readability and maintainability. I'll carefully reorganize state, effects, and helpers, aiming to centralize pagination logic and handle rendering logic cleanly while preserving current behavior.

previous : { ...previous, pageIndex: 0 } + ) + }, [filter, sorting, filters, setPagination]) + + React.useEffect(() => { + const maxIndex = Math.max(pageCount - 1, 0) + setPagination((previous) => + previous.pageIndex > maxIndex ? { ...previous, pageIndex: maxIndex } : previous + ) + }, [pageCount, setPagination]) +} + +function TableBodyRows({ + table, + emptyStateColSpan, + isInitialLoading, + rowsError, + hasNoRows, +}) { + if (isInitialLoading) { + return ( + + + {EMPTY.loading} + + + ) + } + + if (rowsError) { + return ( + + + {rowsError} + + + ) + } + + if (hasNoRows) { + return ( + + + {EMPTY.noRows} + + + ) + } + + const visibleRows = table.getRowModel().rows + if (visibleRows.length === 0) { + return ( + + + {EMPTY.noMatches} + + + ) + } + + return visibleRows.map((row) => ( + + {row.getVisibleCells().map((cell) => { + const isEditable = Boolean(cell.column.columnDef.meta?.isEditable) + const align = resolveCellAlignment(cell.column.columnDef.meta) + const textAlignClass = getTextAlignClass(align) + const isProcessFlowCell = cell.column.id === "process_flow" + + const raw = cell.getValue() + const content = isNullishDisplay(raw) + ? EMPTY.text + : flexRender(cell.column.columnDef.cell, cell.getContext()) + const shouldTruncate = !isProcessFlowCell + const tooltip = shouldTruncate ? formatTooltipValue(raw) : undefined + + return ( + +
+ {content} +
+ + ) + })} + + )) +} + /** * @param {{ lineId: string }} props */ export function DataTable({ lineId }) { *** End Patch

+  const pageCount = table.getPageCount()
+  const currentPage = pagination.pageIndex + 1
+  const totalPages = Math.max(pageCount, 1)
+  const currentPageSize = table.getRowModel().rows.length
+
+  const isRefreshing = isLoadingRows && totalLoaded > 0
+  const lastUpdatedLabel = useLastUpdatedLabel(isLoadingRows, isRefreshing)
+  const isInitialLoading = isLoadingRows && totalLoaded === 0
*** End Patch

payload.text:
**Reviewing table loading and pagination logic**

I'm carefully reasoning through the loading states in TableBodyRows to ensure `isInitialLoading` correctly controls the loading message without flickering during refreshes. The pagination guards rely on `pageCount` changes, so removing dependencies on row counts should be safe since `pageCount` updates appropriately. I’m also checking style helpers like `toWidthStyle` for usage and ESLint violations. Running tests or linting might be too heavy right now, so I'll note that for later and gather git status to confirm changed files before updating the plan.

payload.output: Plan updated

payload.text:
**Summarizing refactor details**

I've refactored the line dashboard data table to isolate layout and state helpers while simplifying the rendering process. The changes include extracting reusable components like `TableBodyRows` and hooks such as `useLastUpdatedLabel` and `usePaginationGuards` to clean up inline logic and maintain consistent layout. The data table rendering is streamlined by reusing width styles and derived data, and the last-updated and pagination effects are handled via hooks instead of boilerplate effects. The table body now manages its loading and empty states within a dedicated component. Behavior remains unchanged but readability is much improved. Testing was not performed as it was not requested. A natural next step could be to run `npm run lint` to ensure code quality. The only file changed is `apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/DataTable.jsx`.

payload.message:
Refactored the line dashboard data table to isolate repeated layout/state logic and simplify rendering.

- `apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/DataTable.jsx`: added small helpers (`toWidthStyle`, `useLastUpdatedLabel`, `usePaginationGuards`) and a `TableBodyRows` component so loading/error/empty states and column width handling live in one place; reused the helpers for headers/colgroup sizing; replaced multiple effects with the pagination guard + last-updated hook to keep page indices in bounds while still updating the timestamp; kept all existing behaviour while making derived values explicit (`visibleColumns`, `pageCount`, `isInitialLoading`).
- Table render now directly composes the new body component instead of inline conditional logic, reducing noise and keeping the top-level JSX focused on layout.

Tests not run (not requested). If you want a quick check, run `npm run lint`.

summary.text:
**Summarizing refactor details**

I've refactored the line dashboard data table to isolate layout and state helpers while simplifying the rendering process. The changes include extracting reusable components like `TableBodyRows` and hooks such as `useLastUpdatedLabel` and `usePaginationGuards` to clean up inline logic and maintain consistent layout. The data table rendering is streamlined by reusing width styles and derived data, and the last-updated and pagination effects are handled via hooks instead of boilerplate effects. The table body now manages its loading and empty states within a dedicated component. Behavior remains unchanged but readability is much improved. Testing was not performed as it was not requested. A natural next step could be to run `npm run lint` to ensure code quality. The only file changed is `apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/DataTable.jsx`.

content.text:
Refactored the line dashboard data table to isolate repeated layout/state logic and simplify rendering.

- `apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/DataTable.jsx`: added small helpers (`toWidthStyle`, `useLastUpdatedLabel`, `usePaginationGuards`) and a `TableBodyRows` component so loading/error/empty states and column width handling live in one place; reused the helpers for headers/colgroup sizing; replaced multiple effects with the pagination guard + last-updated hook to keep page indices in bounds while still updating the timestamp; kept all existing behaviour while making derived values explicit (`visibleColumns`, `pageCount`, `isInitialLoading`).
- Table render now directly composes the new body component instead of inline conditional logic, reducing noise and keeping the top-level JSX focused on layout.

Tests not run (not requested). If you want a quick check, run `npm run lint`.

payload.message:
지킨 항목들 요약할게요:

- AGENTS.md 구조/스타일: 기존 폴더 구조 유지(`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/...`), 함수형 React 컴포넌트/모던 ES 모듈 사용, Tailwind 유틸 클래스 유지.
- 편집 규칙: ASCII만 사용, 주석은 의미 있는 곳에만 추가, 기존 변경은 건드리지 않음, `apply_patch`로 단일 파일 수정.
- 개발자 메시지: 네임드 헬퍼/훅을 추가해 가독성을 높이고 중복을 제거하는 “리팩토링” 요청에 맞춰 기능 유지.
- 테스트: 자동 테스트 미구현 안내에 따라 실행하지 않고, 필요 시 `npm run lint` 제안.

content.text:
지킨 항목들 요약할게요:

- AGENTS.md 구조/스타일: 기존 폴더 구조 유지(`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/...`), 함수형 React 컴포넌트/모던 ES 모듈 사용, Tailwind 유틸 클래스 유지.
- 편집 규칙: ASCII만 사용, 주석은 의미 있는 곳에만 추가, 기존 변경은 건드리지 않음, `apply_patch`로 단일 파일 수정.
- 개발자 메시지: 네임드 헬퍼/훅을 추가해 가독성을 높이고 중복을 제거하는 “리팩토링” 요청에 맞춰 기능 유지.
- 테스트: 자동 테스트 미구현 안내에 따라 실행하지 않고, 필요 시 `npm run lint` 제안.

payload.message:
준수한 세부 지침(“constitution”)을 더 풀어쓰면 다음과 같습니다:

- 작업 범위/구조: 리포 규칙에 따라 `apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/DataTable.jsx` 안에서만 리팩토링하고, 기존 라우팅/파일 구조를 변경하지 않음.
- 코드 스타일: 함수형 React + ES 모듈, 2-space 스타일 유지, Tailwind 유틸 클래스 그대로 사용, 새 주석은 필요한 곳에만 추가(과도한 설명 지양), ASCII만 사용.
- 변경 안전성: 기존 동작(정렬/필터/페이지네이션/리사이즈/상태 카드) 유지, 페이지네이션/업데이트 라벨 로직을 헬퍼 훅으로 분리해 중복 제거만 수행, 사용자가 하지 않은 다른 파일 변경은 건드리지 않음.
- 도구/명령 사용: `rg`/`sed`로 읽기만 수행, `apply_patch`로 단일 파일 수정; 파괴적 명령(`reset` 등) 미사용.
- 플랜 정책: 비단계 작업이 아니어서 간단 계획 후 실행 단계별로 업데이트.
- 테스트/네트워크: 자동 테스트 미설정이므로 실행 생략, 네트워크 호출이나 패키지 설치 같은 제한 행위는 요청하지 않음.
- 출력 규칙: 경로는 `apps/web/src/...` 식으로 명시하고, 요약은 간결하게 제공.

payload.message:
- Updated need-to-send quick filter to reflect that an Error state isn’t expected: removed the special “Error” label and simplified ordering to `on/off` only (`apps/web/src/features/line-dashboard/components/data-table/filters/quickFilters.js`).
- Jira send still shows “Error” when present; need-to-send now shows Y/N, other unexpected values render as-is.

Tests not run (not requested).
